translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Paṇṇadāyaka
The Elder Who Went Forth Seven Days Ago’s Birth Story
“The Sangha of the Fortunate One Vipassī
was honored with the highest honor;
I had fallen into misfortune,
and previously had a split with my relatives.
Having gone forth,
for the sake of overcoming misfortune,
I was devoted there for seven days,
desiring the Teacher’s instruction.
For ninety-one eons
I went forth then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of going forth.
For sixty-seven eons
there were seven kings;
they are known as Sunikkha,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sattāhapabbajito thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā sattāhapabbajitaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder who went forth seven days ago recited these verses.
The Elder Who Went Forth Seven Days Ago’s Birth Story is the eighth.
